TEXT.citation: Early, R. J., & Whitehorn, J. (2003). One hundred Paiwan texts. Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University.
TEXT.BibTeX_citation: @book{100paiwantexts, author = {Robert Early and John Whitehorn}, title = {One Hundred Paiwan Texts}, year = {2003}, publisher = {Pacific Linguistics, Research School of Pacific and Asian Studies, The Australian National University}}

S.FORM: naizua tia sa Pułałułałuyan kati sa Sułupłupan, a puałak tua ałak a maḍusa.
naizoa tia sa Poljaljoljaljoyan kati sa Soljopljopan, a poaljak toa aljak a madrosa.
S.TRANSL: Once upon a time Pułałułałuyan and Sułupłupan had two children.

S.FORM: "ka iumaqan su kaka.
"ka iomaqan so kaka.
S.TRANSL: “Stay at home with your sibling.

S.FORM: vaik anan amen a sema vavua.
vaik anan amen a sema vavoa.
S.TRANSL: We are just going to the fields.

S.FORM: kiman anga tua tja vaqu sa tsugtsugan anga," ayain ti Kułełułełu.
kiman anga toa tja vaqo sa cogcogan anga," ayain ti Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: Find some of our millet and pound it,” they said to Kułełułełu.

S.FORM: saka vaik a kina katua kama a sema vavua.
saka vaik a kina katoa kama a sema vavoa.
S.TRANSL: So mother and father went off to the fields.

S.FORM: sitsugtsug a kaka tua djełep.
sicogcog a kaka toa djeljep.
S.TRANSL: He hit his sibling against a stone wall.

S.FORM: azua "tsugtsugan anga," aya tia kina.
azoa "cogcogan anga," aya tia kina.
S.TRANSL: That was because his mother had said “Pound it”.

S.FORM: sa patsay azua kaka.
sa pacay azoa kaka.
S.TRANSL: So the sibling died.

S.FORM: sa pangtjez a kama katua kina.
sa pangtjez a kama katoa kina.
S.TRANSL: Father and mother came.

S.FORM: "ainu anga su kaka?"
"aino anga so kaka?"
S.TRANSL: “Where is your sibling?”

S.FORM: "uzay namatsay anga.
"ozay namacay anga.
S.TRANSL: “There, dead.

S.FORM: 'tsugtsugan anga,' nu aya mun, avan a ku sitsugtsug."
'cogcogan anga,' no aya mon, avan a ko sicogcog."
S.TRANSL: You said ‘Pound it’; that’s why I pounded her/him.”

S.FORM: "aku a su sitsugtsug?
"ako a so sicogcog?
S.TRANSL: “Why did you pound her/him?

S.FORM: avan a vaqu a ku siaya tu su sitsugtsug."
avan a vaqo a ko siaya to so sicogcog."
S.TRANSL: It was the millet I meant you to pound.”

S.FORM: sa kałia, vaik azua kina katua kama.
sa kaljia, vaik azoa kina katoa kama.
S.TRANSL: Next day mother and father went off.

S.FORM: "lała-an anga tja ḍiḍi," ayain ti Kułełułełu.
"lalja-an anga tja dridri," ayain ti Koljeljoljeljo.
S.TRANSL: “Boil some water for the pig,” they said to Kułełułełu;

S.FORM: sa vaik azua kama katua kina.
sa vaik azoa kama katoa kina.
S.TRANSL: and father and mother went off.

S.FORM: sa pulała zua uta.
sa polalja zoa ota.
S.TRANSL: He put some water on to boil.

S.FORM: ka makalała, djekepen a ḍiḍi sa pasa pariuki, sa patsay azua ḍiḍi.
ka makalalja, djekepen a dridri sa pasa parioki, sa pacay azoa dridri.
S.TRANSL: When it had boiled, he caught the pig and put it in the wok, and the pig died.

S.FORM: sa pangtjez a kina katua kama kasi vavua.
sa pangtjez a kina katoa kama kasi vavoa.
S.TRANSL: Mother and father came back from the fields.

S.FORM: "ainu anga tja ḍiḍi?"
"aino anga tja dridri?"
S.TRANSL: “Where is our pig?”

S.FORM: "azua 'lała-an anga,' aya mun; saka uzay namatsay anga."
"azoa 'lalja-an anga,' aya mon; saka ozay namacay anga."
S.TRANSL: “You said ‘Boil some water for it’; and there it is dead.”

S.FORM: "azua 'lała-an anga,' aya men, ala avan a su sipakanan, nia siaya; saka nakuya tsu," aya.
"azoa 'lalja-an anga,' aya men, ala avan a so sipakanan, nia siaya; saka nakoya co," aya.
S.TRANSL: “When we said ‘Boil some water for it’, we meant it for you to feed it. This is no good,” they said.

S.FORM: sa djaułan tua pulingaw.
sa djaoljan toa polingaw.
S.TRANSL: So they called the shaman.

S.FORM: sa "tja kapalisi, sa djekepu a tja ḍiḍi," ayain nua kama.
sa "tja kapalisi, sa djekepo a tja dridri," ayain noa kama.
S.TRANSL: “We’ll perform a ceremony; you catch our pig,” said his father.

S.FORM: manu avan a kama djekepen.
mano avan a kama djekepen.
S.TRANSL: But it was his father he caught hold of.

S.FORM: "nakuya maitazua.
"nakoya maitazoa.
S.TRANSL: “That’s no good.

S.FORM: avan a ḍiḍi a ku siaya.
avan a dridri a ko siaya.
S.TRANSL: I meant the pig.

S.FORM: ini; nakuya tsu.
ini; nakoya co.
S.TRANSL: No, that’s no good.

S.FORM: kapalisi a kirimu.
kapalisi a kirimo.
S.TRANSL: Let’s perform the ceremony quickly.

S.FORM: tja sukulungay, tja sulutjukay."
tja sokolongay, tja solotjokay."
S.TRANSL: Let’s get rid of his stupidity and evil.”

S.FORM: sa djekepi a kama katua pulingaw, sa patsay anga sakamaya izua.
sa djekepi a kama katoa polingaw, sa pacay anga sakamaya izoa.
S.TRANSL: But he caught hold of his father and the shaman, and they died there and then.

S.FORM: saka amin.
saka amin.
S.TRANSL: The end.
